intro: Coccoloba rufescens, commonly known as the red-leaf coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its striking red or purple leaves, which are often lobed and have a velvety texture. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage. Coccoloba rufescens is also valued for its ability to thrive in humid climates and its potential medicinal uses in traditional practices.
